image.altText: A woman standing in front of her car.

props.synopsis: Police alleged Erin Patterson had poisoned her husband Simon several times, before she served his parents and aunt a beef Wellington lunch containing death cap mushrooms.

title.children: Erin Patterson denied poisoning husband using toxic pasta and chicken curry

image.altText: People walk past an Optus store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Optus could face another hefty penalty, as the privacy watchdog sues the telco over the 2022 cyber attack that exposed the data of around 9.5 million Australians.

title.children: 'Trillions at stake' as Optus sued for alleged data failures

props.synopsis: It's been a big week for the ASX 200 and investors are nearing the peak of a hair-raising psychological journey. But some are peering through their fingers, wondering what's coming next — and when?

title.children: Share market wipe-out 'inevitable' once the peak thrill passes

image.altText: Makeshift white and brown tents set up in a dirt valley bordered by destroyed buildings as green parachutes drop over people

props.synopsis: While Israel's security cabinet has — for now — only approved a takeover of Gaza City, it is still a major escalation in the war that targets the symbolic heart of Gaza and an area that has been largely untouched through the last 22 months of the war.

title.children: Israel has approved a takeover of Gaza City. Here's what that could mean

image.altText: A man wearing a button-up shirt and tie, leaving court while holding his wife's hand.

props.synopsis: The jury in the trial of Netflix star Matt Wright will today hear from witnesses at the scene of the fatal 2022 chopper crash which killed the celebrity crocodile wrangler's close friend and co-star, Chris Wilson.

title.children: Pilot seen disconnecting chopper meter on previous Matt Wright croc egg missions

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Matt Wright told he needs to 'know who to trust'
Pilot disposed of Willow's phone 'all on my own'
Pilot first to arrive at fatal crash scene

image.altText: An Israeli tank moving down a dusty road.

props.synopsis: The Israeli security cabinet's decision marks another escalation of Israel's 22-month military offensive in Gaza, although Benjamin Netanyahu's office has not said when the assault could begin.

title.children: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza City takeover plan, Netanyahu's office says

image.altText: Man in suit holding an umbrella with journalists beside him.

props.synopsis: After the convicted sex offender lost his bid on Thursday to stop the NSW parliament expulsion, Gareth Ward resigned from his position as minister.

title.children: 'Pretty shameful': NSW MP resigns before vote to expel him

image.altText: Peopel stand in front of electronic screens displaying Japanese characters and numbers.

props.synopsis: Australia's privacy watchdog has launched legal action against telco giant Optus, alleging it failed to adequately protect the data of nearly 10 million Australians. Follow live.

title.children: Nikkei jumps as Japan assured Trump will implement agreed tariff deal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The art of the non-deal on US tariffs
Energy, bank stocks drag ASX lower

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg wearing a purple top  wipes her eye

props.synopsis: Wrongfully jailed for 20 years over the deaths of her four children, Kathleen Folbigg has been offered $2 million compensation. Her first lawyer says it should be "a long way north" of that.

title.children: Premier says NSW can only afford $2 million payout for Kathleen Folbigg

image.altText: Nicholas John Crilley in 2015.

props.synopsis: Nicholas John Crilley was sentenced to life imprisonment in 2020 after he pleaded guilty to more than 50 charges over the 23-day attack at a Bulimba unit.

title.children: Court throws out appeal of Brisbane man jailed for life after three week torture of woman

image.altText: Portrait of a white-breasted bird with blue cap and yellow eye against a black background.

props.synopsis: We teamed up with photographers to find out how use a smartphone to take wildlife images, snap tiny creatures, and catch birds in action.

title.children: These photos were taken with a smartphone — and you can do this too

image.altText: Jeremy Howe being stretchered off MCG.

props.synopsis: Veteran Collingwood defender Jeremy Howe is recovering well following a nasty collision in the Magpies' heavy defeat to Hawthorn.

title.children: Howe cleared of further injury after suffering concussion in Magpies' loss

image.altText: Two women and a man stand with their arms around one another outside a court house

props.synopsis: A New South Wales coroner recommends Corrective Services review its systems for informing families, after a father misses the chance to say a final goodbye to his dying son.

title.children: Communication error causes father to miss final moments with dying son

image.altText: A sign outside Sydney Children's Hospital

props.synopsis: The death of a six-year-old girl who was twice sent home for Sydney Children's Hospital has been referred to a coroner.

title.children: Six-year-old girl dies after being turned away twice from Sydney hospital

image.altText: Close up of woman legs wearing home slippers.

props.synopsis: It's that time of year when you may have found yourself searching for how to clean the clothes you only wear during winter. Look no further — here's what an expert has to say.

title.children: How to clean ugg boots, puffer jackets and other tricky winter items

image.altText: Siala, with bleached cropped hair, sings into a microphone held in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Netball's players association says its members are facing "genuine hurt" after an oversight from Netball Australia saw a performer who pleaded guilty to domestic violence singing at last weekend's grand final.

title.children: Players 'genuinely hurt' after performer charged with DV sings at netball grand final

image.altText: A middle aged white man with short grey hair. He's in a wheelchair rolling up a ramp

props.synopsis: The way many people view disability forces those living with it to work within the limitations of a world not designed for them. Could a shift in mindset help move the dial on inclusion?

title.children: Forget what you think you know about disability. It might be all wrong

image.altText: aerial photo of balranald

props.synopsis: A fatal light plane crash in south-west New South Wales will not be investigated because the plane was a recreational aircraft.

title.children: Safety bureau decides not to investigate light plane crash

image.altText: A woman speaks on the phone in shadow.

props.synopsis: A new report into Queensland's DVConnect has found almost 60 per cent of calls went unanswered in October.

title.children: Almost 4,000 calls to DV helpline unanswered in one month, report finds

image.altText: Ginny Jones looking at photos

props.synopsis: Jai Gray disappeared from his home in Morayfield, north of Brisbane, in June last year. His body was found in a quarry about two weeks later.

title.children: Family of 'disappeared' man says police 'wiped their hands clean of him'

image.altText: Close up of woman legs wearing home slippers.

props.synopsis: It's that time of year when you may have found yourself searching for how to clean the clothes you only wear during winter. Look no further — here's what an expert has to say.

title.children: How to clean ugg boots, puffer jackets and other tricky winter items

image.altText: A group of Western United A-League men's players walk off the ground after a game with heads down or looking dejected.

props.synopsis: Just three years after winning the A-League title, Western United is stripped of its licence by Football Australia.

title.children: Beleaguered Western United stripped of A-League licence in 'regrettable' decision

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing over a rural highway

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's proposed cuts to US weather and climate services will cause the loss of critical data Australia relies on for its weather and climate modelling.

title.children: The storm brewing over the world's weather data could reach Australia's forecasts

image.altText: a generic image of a child standing by a window holding a doll. the light is shadowy and their identity isn't clear

props.synopsis: On Thursday, the ABC revealed that a 15-year-old Aboriginal boy died by suicide in a residential care home south-west of Brisbane.

title.children: Whistleblowers allege kids told to stay quiet about residential care suicide

image.altText: woman looks away bored while man in background

props.synopsis: Research shows women losing interest in sex before their male partners is less about not wanting it at all, and more about being bored of the sex on offer.

title.children: Women lose interest in sex faster than men and the mental load plays a part

image.altText: Joseph Suaalii runs the ball for the Wallabies against the Lions.

props.synopsis: Former Wallabies captain Stirling Mortlock says coach Joe Schmidt should consider moving Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii from outside centre to the wing, while calling for a "pick and stick" selection approach.

title.children: Ex-Wallabies skipper proposes Suaalii positional switch

image.altText: A young woman with brown hair and a yellow, black and red scarf sits in a chair in front of windows and smiles.

props.synopsis: When more than 90,000 people marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge it created headlines across the globe. So how has the addition of more than 30 anti-protest laws across the past two decades affected demonstrating?

title.children: Have anti-protest laws changed the way young people demonstrate?

image.altText: Victoria Mboko lifts the Canadian Open trophy as Naomi Osaka bows her head next to her.

props.synopsis: Canadian teenager Victoria Mboko delights crowds in Montreal and Toronto with her Canadian Open final win over four-time grand slam winner Naomi Osaka.

title.children: 18yo Canadian keeps idol Osaka from first WTA trophy in over four years

image.altText: A multi-storey building with arch windows and pink bricks and a Mecca sign on the front.

props.synopsis: About 20,000 people are expected to rush through the doors of cosmetic giant Mecca's new store on its opening day. But is the hype enough to revive Melbourne's hushed CBD after the pandemic?

title.children: The opening of a megastore reflects the revival of retail in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: David Brewster, George Town Airport Association President

props.synopsis: Friends of a missing pilot feared something had gone wrong soon after take-off, and were so worried they took to the sky to search.

title.children: Right from take-off, friends of missing pilot knew something was off

image.altText: Rushanara Ali speaks to reporters surrounded by Labour supporters and wearing a red rosette

props.synopsis: Rushanara Ali is forced to resign over reports she evicted tenants from a property she owned and then increased the rent by nearly $1,500.

title.children: UK homelessness minister quits after being accused of evicting tenants

image.altText: A man looks to pass the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Dolphins and Roosters will put their finals hopes on the line when they meet at Lang Park on Saturday night, in a match that should double as a Dally M face-off for Isaiya Katoa and James Tedesco.

title.children: Champions of past and future collide in Lang Park Dally M showdown

image.altText: Lindsay Lohan and Jamie Lee Curtis peer through a pile of toys in Freakier Friday.

props.synopsis: Freakier Friday is a bubbly, quippy, Disney Channel-style blend of bright colours, battle-of-the-generations comedy and a Chappell Roan soundtrack.

title.children: In Freakier Friday, you get exactly what you paid for
